fields.description:
When working on Source tree 3.0.8 release, it suddenly stops.  Navigating away from it and going back to the application does not open the application. Cannot close the application. Can only be closed from the Task manager.
When rebooting Source tree the opened repository will not open by default.
The crash happens after each push or pull.
fields.summary: Source Tree 3.0.8 release Crash

fields.description:
Our GitLab CE installation uses for enhanced security of HTTPS communication between GitLab server and browser or GitLab's API consuming application the thing called client certificate, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Client_certificate. Every user has his own certificate installed on his computer and it's needed to be used when contacting our GitLab server over HTTPS. But when I try to add GitLab CE account to Sourcetree it seems that Sourcetree doesn't recognize this necessity (as webbrowsers do) and tries to contact GitLab server without using this client certificate, so the communication with GitLab server fails.

This is the same issue as it is with macOS version of Sourcetree: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-5956
fields.summary: GitLab CE account can't be added when HTTPS communication is hardened with client certificate

fields.description:
Hi,

The downloads on your main page are swapped for mac and windows.
fields.summary: Site using wrong links

fields.description:
I installed the new SourceTree 3.0.6 (and then 3.0.8) on my machines and I am seeing a consistent issue on all.  I usually keep SourceTree always open and minimized.  The 3.0.x version will not restore anymore if left minimized "for some time".  It will restore if done shortly after minimizing, but after some undetermined time (minutes), it will get stuck minimized and I have to kill the process and restart it manually. 

This is quite an annoyance restricting the use of 3.0 so would be great to get fixed.
fields.summary: Minimized window will not restore anymore

fields.description:
Left-clicking on the "Download for Windows" button pops up the a dialog. Clicking "Download" results in downloading the MacOS .zip file.

Workaround: If we right-click on the "Download for Windows" button -> open in new tab -> this results in .exe getting downloaded (which is the correct installer).
fields.summary: Attempting to download SourceTree 3.0.8 from https://www.sourcetreeapp.com/ results in downloading the MacOSX .zip instead of the Windows exe

fields.description:
I came to the bug report form from Contact Atlassian Support because I was having difficulty getting the windows installer from the download page. I figured that out on my own, and there appears to be another bug ticket already.

 

However, I also noticed that the "download latest version for windows" link on the Contact Atlassian Support page for sourcetree is a link to the version 2.0.19.1, which appears to be very old.
fields.summary: Contact Atlassian Support page shows old Sourcetree version as newest

fields.description: I'm using windows, when I hit Download Windows version it downloads the mac version. I have to click on Mac Version to get windows version of SourceTree
fields.summary: Download link takes you to mac app and not windows

fields.description:
Hi

I have several kind of authentication issues in sourcetree. So I decided to reinstall git and uncheck using windows credential manager hoping this solve my issues allowing sourcetree to manage credentials itself, but still suffering. I've diferentiated 2 possible scenarios:

*Issue 1*

I'm struggling with authentication when try to push/pull from different repos with different accounts. This is working perfect in command line.

Steps to reproduce:

1- create 2 different accounts on Bitbucket

2- clone repositories (at this step probably you'll get the error but not sure)

3- modify any files in both repos and try to commit / push or fetch (3 checks checked)

4- sourcetree will ask for credentials,

Expected:

Typing right email/password should connect and do the staff

Actual result

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks fetch --prune --tags origin
fatal: ArgumentException encountered.
 An item with the same key has already been added.

fatal: ArgumentException encountered.
 An item with the same key has already been added.

fatal: Authentication failed for 'http://.....

 

*Issue 2*

Can't add Bitbucket accounts in Tools>Options - Authentication tab

Steps to reproduce:

1- Go to Tools>Options - Authentication tab --> Add

2- Input data:

Hosting service: bitbucket

Protocol: https

Authentication: Basic

username: a valid user

3- Click on Refresh password button

Expected:

account is added to list

Actual

If I enter my real password:

Invalid URI: The hostname could not be parsed

If I enter an invalid password:

Failed to check login for user xxxxx

You do not have permission to access URL '[https://api.bitbuket.org/1.0/user/follows'] The request returned with status code 'Unauthorized'

Please fix asap.
fields.summary: Authentication problems dealing with different accounts

fields.description:
One of the repositories I have always open in SourceTree started hanging the whole program in Windows 10 AFTER I click on a different branch or a different commit. Please note that my environment is a virtual machine windows 10 and some  of the drives including desktop are on NETWORK. 

 

Also note that Windows' close prompt WILL NOT close sourcetree despite me clicking on "close program" button. I kill it with process manager and there are no logs or anything even on the event viewer

 

It is a critical error but only happens in one single repository out of 8 I use SourceTree with.
fields.summary: SourceTree hangs on some (one actually) repositories when clicking on commits or branches

fields.description:
External diff runs (w/o a reason) each time when I select any of "Unstaged files" (File Status windows) that are deemed (by the SourceTree) as "binary" (status: "No changes in this file have been detected, or it is a binary file"), though these are XML files from Java projects such as: .classpath, .project etc.

Surprisingly the external diff is still called after it was disabled (switched to SystemDefault)!?

!image-2018-10-29-09-42-50-202.png!
fields.summary: External diff is called w/o reason for each file deemed as "binary"

fields.description:
Sourcetree 3.0.8 or any other 3.x version

Windows 10 64bit

please QA your app before releasing it to the public. This is beyond broken.
fields.summary: Sourcetree version 3.0.8 is completely BROKEN on windows 10
Underscore not shown in Diff, on Windows

fields.description: Sourcetree will at a certain interval show a login window for github, if i leave sourcetree open for a night the result will be an almost unusable system because sourcetree opened hundreds of these login windows plus spawned "git.exe", "git-credential-manager.exe" and related processes.

fields.description: It is very annoying, I have to restart SourceTree, or click like 50 times before window will be shown again.

fields.description:
SourceTree keeps asking for the same credentials over and over again. This usually happens after the app has been idle for a little while. It will just pop up a window asking to authenticate to git and then keep popping up windows every second. This occurs for regular GIT credentials and Atlasian accounts.  I left SourceTree open over the weekend and it had thousands of windows open and completely locked up the computer. 

I literally can't use SourceTree because it freaks out like this.

I have a whole bunch of windows error reporting dumps about it but i can't attach a file here because this system says a 'token is missing'.
fields.summary: SourceTree authentication goes bonkers asking multiple times a second
Custom actions in the toolbar

fields.description:
There is a bug on Source tree where account login dialog shows in more instances than one.

One Sourcetree is installed on system so it should have only one instance of dialog.

Also when I enter credentials it done not tell me if they are valid or not.

Dialog just closes.

fields.description:
Steps:

1.Open Source Three application on Windows 10

2. Press minimizing button ( "_" )

3. Press on icon in tool bar

 

Expect result: Show me Source Three opened

Actual result: System sound and i must kill application and open it again
fields.summary: Minimizing broke sourcethree application on windows 10
安装成功运行失败
安装成功启动失败

fields.description:
When committing to a GitLab repository with SSH using the "Create Pull Request" commit option, SourceTree constructs the incorrect URL and a 404 is returned.

The URL that is opened is: https://gitlab.com/git@gitlab.com/<groupname>/<projectname>/merge_requests/...

It should be https://gitlab.com/<groupname>/<projectname>/merge_requests/...

It's pretty frustrating that this got to production since it was identified in 3.0.0-beta1893 (https://groups.google.com/forum/?utm_medium=email&utm_source=footer#!msg/atlassian-sourcetree-beta/Ia_ccLweONU/zlrAV_jOEgAJ).
fields.summary: Incorrect URL for commit with pull request for GitLab

fields.description:
Starting with Version 1709, Windows 10 includes an OpenSSH client and server that you can enable as optional features in settings.

The advantage of this is not only that no additional installation of OpenSSH is necessary when using Windows but also that the included SSH agent leverages the Windows Credential Manager to store any SSH key passphrases in the registry securely encrypted with the Windows user password. This means that the SSH agent automatically unlocks the SSH keys during login so it is not necessary to enter the passphrases when starting the SSH agent as would be the case when using PuTTY Pageant or Git's inbuilt SSH agent on Windows.

Git has a configuration flag in the global .gitconfig under [core] called sshCommand that you can set to a custom path to the SSH executable. Setting this to Windows' own SSH client ("{color:#172b4d}C:\Windows\System32\OpenSSH\ssh.exe"{color}) lets Git use Windows' own SSH agent as well. This setting works without issue in Git Bash or in e.g. VS Code.

However, SourceTree seems to ignore this setting and keeps using Git's built-in SSH agent under (by default) "C:\Program Files\Git\usr\bin\ssh-agent.exe". This is when using SourceTree's presetting "OpenSSH" for the SSH client.

Please update SourceTree to either use said configuration flag in the .gitconfig or to let one specify a custom path to an SSH client in SourceTree's settings.
fields.summary: SourceTree ignores core.sshCommand configuration in global .gitconfig

fields.description:
Up until a version or two ago, commit-all would open the commit view with all changed files staged. Now it just opens the view but stages nothing. This makes it the same behavior as commit-staged-changes.

This slows down my workflow and breaks my ability to execute a basic commit using only the keyboard. As such, it incites me to use IDE git for regular work, and only pull out SourceTree when things get complicated.
fields.summary: Commit-all no longer stages any files

fields.description: It is very annoying, I have to restart SourceTree, or click like 50 times before window will be shown again.
fields.summary: Unminimize SourceTree does not work or needs 20-50 clicks on its app icon in taskbar

fields.description:
In a number of places Sourcetree introduces an extra click into the workflow by prompting for confirmation for a potentially destructive action. The one that affects me most is after clicking the checkbox for a force-push (something I very frequently do on private branches after pushing for immediate offsite backup). Having explicitly clicked to select a force push, it then asks me again to confirm this.

It would be much nicer, and no less risky, to change the button to red (or a red border and text) and change the text of it to "Force Push". It doesn't help that I have a 43" monitor and the confirmation popup appears nowhere near the push dialog button.

Even better workflow would be to (also) allow CTRL+click on the push button in the toolbar to push the current branch to the default remote without any intervening popups and CTRL+SHIFT+click to do the same for force-push, both with appropriate changes the hover appearance or showing an immediate hint with the warning.
fields.summary: Too many clicks to push to remote.

fields.description: Custom Diff tool settings are not working correctly. Always overwrites the .gitconfig file entries with the default values.
fields.summary: External Diff-Tool 'Diff Command' and 'Arguments' being overwritten

fields.description:
If the UI is minimized or in the background. Double clicking the taskbar icon does not reopen / bring the UI to front. Either you kill sourcetree or you need to wait long enough until the UI shows up.

Just a guess, but it seems that the tray-icon double-click triggers a refresh similar to F5 causing it to hang for same time.

This behavior is frustrating.
fields.summary: GUI does not open when minimized to taskbar and a refresh job runs
SourceTree Hang for a while when it first start

fields.description:
I like to order my local repositories by name within my created folders.
I think it can be added to the right-click menu => Sort/order alphabetically.
fields.summary: Sort local repositories in alphabetical within folders

fields.description:
Hi!

Sourcetree keeps asking for login details over and over again. I have tried basic login (username + password) and OAuth, both have the same problem. I have had this problem since 2.6.9, now I am using 3.0.8. If I ignore the login prompt, more are opened at a constant interval. This leads to that I have to turn off Sourcetree when working, very frustrating of course.  !Capture.PNG!
fields.summary: Sourcetree frequently asks for password
Cannot clone from Bitbucket using SourceTree

fields.description:
Sourcetree just updated to version 3.0.8.

It starts normally. After the +first minimization of its window, it gets stuck minimized forever+. When clicking on the minimized icon to restore it, the error sound of windows is initiated (like when deleting an open file). However no visual error appears anywhere. The minimized icon responds normally to right click->close.

(The pc was restarted after the install. The issue persists.)

  

Edit: This is a duplicate issue to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-9301 which I didn't notice when I created this.
fields.summary: Sourcetree stays minimized forever

fields.description:
This Bitbucket login page keeps popping up. Around every 5 minutes. Starting from 3.0.8, two pop up at a time. In previous versions, only one could be open at a time, now I get 20 if I walk away for a while. It gets annoying quickly.

I have removed this account months ago from Sourcetree, but it just keeps on coming. Some forums suggested switching to switch to system Git and back, but that did not work.
fields.summary: Bitbucket login popup every 5 minutes

fields.description: After minimizing the application, it is impossible to restore the window. The only solution is to right-click the taskbar icon, close the application and restarting it.
fields.summary: Unable to restore minimized application

fields.description:
After updating to v3.0.6 recently (and now using v3.0.8), I am getting VERY frequent prompts to enter credentials for an old stash (Bitbucket Server) URL that is no longer in existence. I cannot find any place where the URL to this old server is referenced. None of my repos in SourceTree reference it and the Authentication tab in Options does not reference it.

Prior to updating to v3.0.6 I was not getting this prompt. I am currently using embedded Git. 

Since updating to v3.0.8, I am getting two separate prompts (see attachments)

I also started this post on the Community forum regarding this: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Git-Credential-Manager-for-Windows-Popups-in-v3-0-6/qaq-p/917669?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=immediate_general_answer&utm_content=topic&lightbox-message-images-922733=35760iA6511A7823C10A84]
fields.summary: Git Credential Manager for Windows dialog continually displayed for non-existent stash server

fields.description:
Using 3.0.8 (also noticed in earlier versions) when "Flat list (multiple columns)" is selected the log view will often select multiple files when refreshing or clicking between commits.  On occasion this has caused me to stage or discard more than I intended.

This doesn't happen with "Flat list (single column)" but I want the file list sorted by path so I generally use the multiple column view.

I'm not sure how to reproduce it - it is more readily seen when clicking through past commits but it does happen for uncommited changes as well.
fields.summary: "Flat list (multiple columns)" selects multiple files

fields.description:
When trying to register using Bitbucket Server and your username contains @, the registration fails with the following error message:

!Register BB3.png!

If you use a username that does not contain @, the registration is successful. The problem with 3.0.8 is that you have now removed the option to use an Atlassian account to register, which prevents my users from installing 3.0.8. The only workaround is to install 2.6.10, and then run the upgrade.
fields.summary: Unable to register with Bitbucket Server if username contains @

fields.description:
*NOTE! "Affects Version/s" does not offer the latest currently released version (3.0.8.2279), to which this report refers to!*

Functionality to "Commit All..." (Ctrl+Shift+C) not working at all after update to 3.0.8.2279

Steps to reproduce
 # Have changes in unstaged files pending staging
 # Press Ctrl+Shift+C
 ## Expected: files get staged & focus moves to commit-message window
 ## Result: Nothing happens
 # Navigate to "Repository"-menu > "Commit All..."
 ## Expected: files get staged & focus moves to commit-message window
 ## Result: Nothing happens
fields.summary: "Commit All..." functionality not working

fields.description:
After upgrading from 2.6.10.0 to 3.0.8 through the source tree updater on Windows 10, when I minimise SourceTree I am unable to restore the application unless I click many times in the sourcetree icon in the toolbar.

Downgraded to 2.6.10.0 and there are no issues.

I have a dual monitor set up if this helps.
fields.summary: SourceTree won't open after minimise

fields.description: When searching the list of repositories for a Bitbucket Server account, the search is case-sensitive. This would be far more useful if it were case-insensitive.
fields.summary: Remote repositories search should be case-insensitive

fields.description:
I am using GitFlow to manage my repo. However, I noticed that when I invoke the "complete feature" command (via the GUI) , and if my local feature branch has been pushed to the server, the command will fail with an unknown HTTP error.

This does not happen if the feature branch is local only. It also does not matter if I check the "delete branch" option. 

Steps to reproduce:

1) Clone a new repo from bitbucket.

2) open the repo in sourcetree , the windows version

3) initialize the repo for GitFlow

4) create a new feature

5) make some changes, commit and also push the branch to the server

6) click the GitFlow button and select "finish feature"

 

the command will fail with an HTTP error.
fields.summary: GitFlow "complete feature" fails if the feature branch is also in remote

fields.description: After creating several branches, committing changes and merging back into master the graph still shows a straight line.  We don't see the branches anymore like in older versions.  Is there a setting that needs to be checked?  OR maybe i'm doing something wrong.  What would be the correct way to display the graph correctly?
fields.summary: Can not see branch merges back into master
SourceTree has difficulty completing all actions
use a more recent version of git
Win 10 SourceTree.  excessive instances of git running in the background.  I had 100+ seperate instances.  I have had this happen several times.  Kill the machine.

fields.description:
First of all, the 3.0.6 version doesn't appear in the "Affects Version/s" list. So I choose the 3.0.5. Not sure if it is also a bug in this Create Issue :) But 3.0.6 is what I see when I click in Help -> About in the SourceTree.

 

----------------

 

When I try to pull / push from Azure DevOps repositories it gives me the error below.

It doesn't happen if:
 * I pull / push with same version, but from other repositories (tested with GitLab and GitHub).
 * I pull / push the same repository, but with a previous version (tested with SourceTree version 2.6.0)
 * I pull / push the same repository, but with other tool (tested with TortoiseGit)

So, I could reduce the surface to happening at least with SourceTree 3.0.6 pulling repositories from Azure DevOps Git.

Here goes the error log that is shown when I click the "Show Full Output" checkbox:
{quote}git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks fetch origin
 fatal: ArgumentException encountered.
 An item with the same key has already been added.

fatal: ArgumentException encountered.
 An item with the same key has already been added.

error: cannot spawn C:\Users\ruipi\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-3.0.6\tools\Askpass.exe: No error
{quote}
fields.summary: Error "An item with the same key(...)" when pulling / pushing from Azure DevOps

fields.description: When connecting to a git-svn repository I was expecting to be able to stage specific lines rather than all the changes made in a file. The functionality I was expecting is very much like how source tree behaves when dealing with a "vanilla" git repository where I could select hunks of changes to commit rather than all the changes made. This expectation comes from the basis that when interacting with a git-svn repository through the command line interface particular hunks can be committed to the local git repository which when pushed to svn using dcommit creates an svn commit for each git commit made locally
fields.summary: Can't commit selected lines to git-svn repository

fields.description:
Since last upgrade Bitbucket Login popups are popping up every few minutes, which is really annoying and disruptive for work process. 

 

I don't want to login to Bitbucker, I want to work with local repositories.

 

Screenshot is after about 1 hour after opening Sourcetree.

 

This is for version 3.0.6.

And when I wanted to create this Issue, I got the message that version 3.0.6 doesn't exist ...
fields.summary: Bitbucket Login popups

fields.description:
After the last update, I now have the following symptom: 

I run SourceTree and it seems to work fine.  *I minimize it, and then later go to restore it.  It does not restore.*  This is consistent and happens every time.   Instead of restoring, I hear the windows beep that you get when you click on something out of focus - maybe there is a dialog that is hidden that is blocking it? (Though I don't see any such dialog when I Alt_Tab and look at the preview, it does sort-of behave that way.) 

I try Alt+Tab, and I can tab over to Sourcetree, but it still does not open, (I just hear the beep).

If I right-click on SourceTree in the task bar, I can close it with the "X Close Window" option, and then it will open fine again.  This is the only thing I have found that helps.

Rebooting the computer did not seem to help.

This issue does not occur on my second PC, even though the setups are identical as far as I can tell.
fields.summary: Sourcetree will not restore after minimized

fields.description: When I try to pull, it always throws exception.
fields.summary: Output window throws ArgumentExceptions

fields.description:
The +arguments+ for the external Diff and Merge commands under the Diff tab of the Options are not saved to the user.config file.

The user cannot use a custom Diff/Merge tool this way.
fields.summary: Custom diff/merge tool arguments not saved

fields.description: When trying to establish a connection with my partners repository a window prompts and ask for my password. Sometimes several windows pops up and continually does not accept my password. After changing password several times and reinstalling 2 times I still experience this bug.
fields.summary: Sourcetree not connecting to bitbucket when trying to clone repository

fields.description:
The $LOCAL and $REMOTE arguments aren't be substituted correctly. Ends up having the arguments twice, non-substituted plus substituted.

e.g.

"C:\Program Files\TortoiseGit\bin\TortoiseGitMerge.exe" \"$LOCAL\" \"$REMOTE\" "c:\users\blah\appdata\local\temp\extdiff.rsbxh4\Blah.629d383316f4\myfile.txt" "C:\Development\Blah\myfile.txt"
fields.summary: Hg external diff arguments incorrect

fields.description:
Hello,

I am trying to install SourceTree 2.6.10 on Windows 2012 R2 server. Installation prompts for login credential, I selected "Atlassian Account". Entered my user name and password and received the following: "Something went wrong while attempting to validate your credentials".

I am able to login to https://id.atlassian.com/ using IE from the same server.

I've searched knowledge base and found several articles reporting similar problem however they do not contain a fix or workaround.

Many thanks,
Vitaliy
fields.summary: Unable to install SourceTree

fields.description:
In SourceTree, when opening a new tab you can search for local repo's.

I always work on more than one Project at a time...and often my Projects can be in the same application.

Searching my local repo's only returns results of the application name.....not my Branch name.....I name my Branches based on my Projects' purpose, like: add-a-driver, fix-missing-coverage, change-comprehensive-deductible...and the like....all the while they're in the same application.

Often, my Projects span multiple applications and searching by Branch name will show me all my repo's based on that feature.

When searching local repo's, will you please return repo's based on Branch name too? Pretty please? With sugar on top? :)
fields.summary: searching local repo's AND Branches

fields.description:
After minimizing the SourceTree Application window to the Windows task bar, it does not restore anymore by clicking on its task bar icon. All I can do is "Close window" from the context menu and restart SourceTree.

*This relates to version 3.0.6 which was not selectable in the "Create Issue" window!* Previous versions did not have this problem.

[Update] I've updated to SourceTree 3.0.8 and the problem is still there.
fields.summary: Minimized SourceTree Window does not restore
GitFlow does not finish feature branch

fields.description:
For the following path, Sourcetree couldn't validate the git repository type and keeps checking the source file.

[https://suvvi@bitbucket.org/suvvi/suvvi_training.git]

If I tried to clone from remote account, system is prompting me with Atlassian Bitbucket Login popup and not validating the credentials and the same login page reappears.
fields.summary: SourceTree for Windows 10 not recognizing git repository when I try cloning

fields.description:
I have cloned multiple projects yesterday and today and in two of them, the top-level "readme.md" file is shown in my "Uncomitted Changes" in the "Unstaged files" area.

If I try and select the file and choose "Discard", it seems to endlessly toggle between the last two commits. But it will not "Discard" so that it is removed from my "Unstaged Files".

---

Steps to reproduce:

origin/head, origin/master and origin/develop are their initial versions with the simple Readme.md file as the only file checked in/committed.

A developer has created a feature branch for their work – they are actually moving over a project from a different repo.

So in my local branches, I just have the develop branch.

Everything looks great. In SourceTree I select Remotes->origin->feature->new-feature-name and I right-click and check it out.

After everything is pulled down, I then have an "Uncommitted changes" in the Readme.md file.

The history of the feature is an export/replay of the history from a different repo where the code is being migrated from.
fields.summary: Clone a new repo from our BitBucket and the Readme.md file is marked as "changed"

fields.description:
I have two different tools for (external) merging and diffing:
* WinMerge (for diffing)
* KDiff3 (for merging)

When rebasing or merging, and a conflict occurs, I select Resolve Conflicts => Launch External Merge Tool via context menu.

However, while SourceTree sets up everything for merging (i.e. creates the base, local, remote files), it then launches WinMerge (i.e. my diff tool), which doesn't know what to do with those files. Upon closing WinMerge, SourceTree then considers the merge done, and neither "Restart Merge" nor "Mark Unresolved" do anything.
fields.summary: Launch External Merge Tool launches wrong tool

fields.description:
on win7, after minimizing sourcetree, it is almost impossible to select sourcetree in the taskbar.

After clicking the minimized application, nothing happens.

It needs multiple tries, hovering with the mouse over its icon and selecting the mini display/tooltip and then sometimes sourcetree pops up.
fields.summary: most of the time sourcetree does not show when pressing its icon in the taskbar

fields.description:
I am using version 3.0.6 of SourceTree for Windows. When I click the "Minimize" button in the upper right-hand corner of the window (to collapse the app into the taskbar) I am unable to restore the app by clicking on its icon. Clicking the icon is now a NOOP. The only way to restore the app to its old size is to do the following:

A) highlight or activate the icon in the taskbar, then use Alt+Space to 'activate' the icon

B) now you can select 'Restore' from the context menu
fields.summary: Cannot restore SourceTree from Windows 7 by clicking on taskbar icon

fields.description:
After updating Git to 2.19.1 this morning, I wasn't able to push or pull from our internal Bitbucket company repository.
{noformat}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks push -v --tags origin master:master
 fatal: ArgumentException encountered.
 An element with the same key has alredy been added
fatal: ArgumentException encountered.
fatal: Authentication failed for 'https://<user>@<my-bitbucket-url>'
 Pushing to https://<user>@<my-bitbucket-url>{noformat}
I searched in the GUI for stored credentials. neither in SourceTree, nor in the Windows credential store were any found. Using CLI from git it works.

Found *%localappdata%\Atlassian\SourceTree\passwd* and noticed that my Bitbucket password is present in it, altough the GUI in options say that no stored credential exists:

!SourceTree_2018-10-15_11-25-48.png|thumbnail!

 

After deleting those passwd file, SourceTree ask me for credentials and pushing/polling is possible. When checking the "save credentials" checkbox, the file is re-created. But in the GUI I still can't see the credentials.
fields.summary: SourceTree store credentials in passwd file and doesn't show them in UI options

fields.description:
I've upgraded today to 3.0.6.2192 and I cannot minimize my Source Tree - because if I do, then it won't come back again. Even Shift-right click on taskbar and clicking "Restore" or "Maximize" won't show the Source Tree window.

 

Also why I cannot find that version in Affected Versions list? Am I using beta or what is this non-existing update version 3.0.6.2192???
fields.summary: After minimizing SourceTree I cannot restore it back

fields.description:
When double clicking on the separator between the column Graph and column Description (when the graph is on its smallest size) the graph column itself is resizing to the maximum size but the Headers are not updated and the Description column is not resizing.

The result is a graph column that is larger than it's header and that is drawing over the description texts

 

!2018-10-15_09h58_59.png!

fields.description:
I am trying to install sourcetree 2.6.10 on my windows 10 Enterprise edition, but it asks for .NET framework 4.7.1, but this version of .NET framework is not yet supported in Windows 10 enterprise edition. 

I try older releases of sourceapp giving problem during its installation and cannot go further after step no 3, because I cannot configure my Atlassian account. on 3rd step to enter Atlassian account, the blank screen appears as seen in the screen shot.
fields.summary: Problem in installing on Windows 10 Enterprise Edition

fields.description: Sometimes (I don't have a solid repro case), the Push Changes Immediately text/checkbox flashes on and off and makes it very hard to click. It seems to be unaffected by staging or unstaging anything. I'm unsure what settings I can change to effectively narrow down when it happens and when it doesn't, but it's been an issue for a couple versions now.
fields.summary: "Push changes immediately" flashing on and off

fields.description:
I updated SourceTree on Windows to 3.0.6. The app window comes up OK when first launched, but if I minimize the window, then I can't restore the window, either by clicking on the icon in the Task bar, or Alt-Tab switching to the app. Nothing I do will restore the window. I need to quit the application (e.g., with the Task Manager), then restart the app.

 

According to the About dialog, the version is 3.0.6, although the bug report won't allow me to specify this. The largest number I can select is 3.0.5.

Also note that I had been running SourceTree 2.x on Windows, and was prompted today to update to 3.0.6. I had not been running any version of 3.* prior to this.
fields.summary: App won't restore after being minimized

fields.description:
SourceTree will NOT stop asking for my password.


I may be confusing some details, but I believe I had a generic BitBucket account under the username *dcholth*.  At some point BitBucket gave me the option to convert or use this as a Google authenticated account.  I chose this option.

Since then, SourceTree will not properly save my authentication and continues to ask me for my password.

I've seen community responses to this, and none of the suggestions have helped.  Steps I've taken to try to correct the issue:

*Access Management:*

Old Bitbucket account password:  When it asks for a password, I can use my OLD (pre-google login) password for it to work.

_OAuth:_ It shows that Source Tree for windows is authorized.  I've tried Revoking and re-adding to no effect.

App passwords:  I've created an app password for SourceTree.  I've revoked and re-addeded to no effect.

I've tried both of these in combinations.

 

They both work at the start but then after a period of time, or I close source tree, it AGAIN asks me for a password.

Also note, and I feel like this shouldn't be the case, I can login to my account via my old Bitbucket authentication AND google. 

 

*Version:*  3.0.6 (Not yet an option in your Jira tickets)
fields.summary: Source Tree Always Asks for BitBucket Password

fields.description:
When trying to add a Remote Hosting Account for the newly support GitLab (Remote Repositories -> Add an account...), selecting GitLab (gitlab.com) and pressing "Refresh Personal Access Token" I get prompted for my gitlab.com Username and Password. After entering these, I get an error message:

"Authentication Failed

Failed to check login for user []

User Details check failed"

 

The "Username" input field just above the "Refresh Personal Access Token"-button is not editable (I can not enter any value).

 

I was looking forward to SourceTree finally supporting GitLab, but sadly it doesn't seem to work yet.
fields.summary: GitLab "Failed to check login for user []"

fatal: ArgumentException encountered.

# Open SourceTree
 # Click minimize button, application minimizes

Actual result: nothing happens

Expected result: SourceTree window restores
fields.summary: Source Tree window does not restore when minimized using minimize button

fields.description:
h2. Problem

Cloning a repo from a remote account with SSH fails when multiple SSH keys are loaded into an SSH Agent. I believe this is because it uses the first SSH key that is valid in the whole of bitbucket.org and not just for that user/team. Changing the URL from {{git@bitbucket.org:<team_or_user>/<repo>.git}} to {{<username>@bitbucket.org:<team_or_user>/<repo>.git}} fixes this issue but I don't want to have to manually do this every time.
h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a remote Bitbucket account with the Preferred Protocol set to SSH
 # Load an SSH key into an SSH Agent (e.g. Pageant) that is valid on bitbucket.org but not valid for the remote account created in step 1
 # Load the SSH ket into an SSH Agent that is valid for the remote account created in step 1
 # In the main UI click the plus to create a new tab
 # Click {{Remote}} top left
 # Select the remote account created in step 1
 # Choose a repo to clone and click {{Clone}}
 # The {{Source Path / URL}} is automatically entered in the format {{git@bitbucket.org:<team_or_user>/<repo>.git}}
 # SourceTree to check the source
 # An error message is displayed below the {{Source Path / URL}} "This is not a valid source path / URL"
 # Clicking {{Details..}} displays this error: 
{code:java}
Command: git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false ls-remote git@bitbucket.org:<team_or_user>/<repo>.git
Output: 
Error: repository access denied.
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.{code}

 # Changing {{git}} to {{<username>}} works

h2. Solution

When cloning from a remote the Source Path / URL should be filled in with the username of the remote account instead of git.
h2. Note

This issue is only for {{bitbucket.org}}. {{github.com}} works fine as {{git@github.com}}. In fact, it doesn't support {{<username>@github.com}}.
fields.summary: Use <username>@bitbucket.org for SSH protocol

fields.description:
In the differences view the horizontal scrollbar is only visible at the bottom of a change with the content of x lines. 

When this number of lines is set to (e.g.) 12, the horizontal scrollbar rarely visible. This issue doesn't occur when this settings is set to 6.
fields.summary: Horizontal scroll bar not always visible in differences

fields.description:
Fresh install works well. Cloned repository from Bitbucket. When sourcetree is closed and reopened, fake repository tab shows and then sourcetree crashes. I have tried all the possible solutions I could find on the web: deleting all my AppData/Temp, AppDat/Local/Sourcetree.

However non of it worked.
fields.summary: Sourcetree opens fake repository on restart and then crashes

fields.description:
The SourceTree window cannot be restored when it was minimized by clicking on the top right corners minimize icon.

Workaround, as described in other tickets:
Click on the SourceTree icon, then use {{ALT + SPACE}} and select {{Restore}} from context menu.

Tickets reporting the same issue:
- SRCTREEWIN-9313
- SRCTREEWIN-9331
- SRCTREEWIN-9305
- SRCTREEWIN-9303
- SRCTREEWIN-9304
- SRCTREEWIN-9423
- SRCTREEWIN-9458
- SRCTREEWIN-9324
- SRCTREEWIN-9301

fields.description:
Something is wrong with credentials. This is a nightmare.

This is what does work.

Start terminal.
{noformat}
ben@DESKTOP-HCPIRxxx MINGW64 /c/dev/xxx/xxx (master)
$ git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks fetch origin{noformat}
works fine.

 

None of the same operations work in sourcetree. fetch, pull.

 

 
{noformat}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks fetch origin
fatal: ArgumentException encountered.
 An item with the same key has already been added.
fatal: ArgumentException encountered.
 An item with the same key has already been added.
fatal: ArgumentException encountered.
 An item with the same key has already been added.
fatal: ArgumentException encountered.
 An item with the same key has already been added.

 An item with the same key has already been added.
fatal: ArgumentException encountered.
 An item with the same key has already been added.
fatal: ArgumentException encountered.
 An item with the same key has already been added.
fatal: ArgumentException encountered.
 An item with the same key has already been added.
{noformat}

fields.description:
If I minimize SourceTree, I can't un-minimize it.

Doesn't matter if SourceTree was maximized or not.

After minimizing, if I click on the taskbar icon, I get a generic Windows error 'ding', but nothing visible.

I can't alt-tab to bring SourceTree up either.

This is a new bug in version 3.  Specifically I'm on 3.0.6.  It didn't affect me on the previous, latest v2 version a couple days ago.

This bug is also affecting one other co-worker of mine on a different machine.  I'm not alone! :)
fields.summary: Can't un-minimize SourceTree

fields.description:
# Click on a line in the diff viewer (e.g. when previewing a commit in the log/history tab)
 # Ctrl+C
 # Paste in any IDE/text editor
 # Any tabs present in the original source file have been converted to four spaces

It would be very useful for any lines copied from the diff viewer to have their original whitespace preserved. I often find myself wanting to grab a line I deleted a few commits ago, and do so by selecting the commit where I removed it and copying it out of the diff viewer. Because the diff viewer converts tabs to spaces, I have to fix the whitespace every time.
fields.summary: Accurately copy whitespace to clipboard from diff view

fields.description: After upgrading from SourceTree 2.x to *3.0.6* (dropdown only let me select 3.0.5), whenever I minimize the application window, when I click in the taskbar to try and see it again, the window will not come back in to view. Hovering over the taskbar icon will show a preview of the window however. I have to close and reopen Sourcetree to view the window again.
fields.summary: Cannot see SourceTree Window after minimizing
This product sucks.

fields.description:
When I press the Commit button, it pops up a window so fast that I can not see it. It won't let me continue.
I've got the commit down to just deleting a file. The popup window has three buttons: refresh, skip, cancel but I still can't read the message.
I've pressed the button a dozen more times and can make out the word "submodule".
I went to Tools/Option/git and unchecked the option "Check submodules before commit and push".
It now lets me commit So I've change the priority to low.
fields.summary: Can't commit

fields.description:
Notice new icon in upper right corner with a white exclamation mark on red, indicating an error or immediate action required.

Click on icon, modal popup says:
{quote}You don't have any remotes which have extended integration settings configured; you need to edit your remotes to add details such as the hosting type and base URL. Click the Settings button to open your remote list.
{quote}
Click on the Settings button, this opens the "Repository Settings" dialog.

"origin" is present as expected for this project. Select it, click edit.

There's no obvious way to edit the "Generic Account" from there, and no support for GitHub Enterprise in the Legacy Account Settings dropdown.
fields.summary: Missing optional integration should not cause error style notification in UI

fields.description:
Open SourceTree

Select a changed file in the work tree, or a file added to the index

SourceTree opens the external diff tool, in a loop

Happens only with current pending commit, does not happen with already committed ones

Does not happen with SourceTree 2.6.x
fields.summary: SourceTree opens external diff tool without any user interaction

fields.description:
Really!!!!!   I can't even use one bit of your source tree for Windows without hanging. Its so so slow, and by slow I dont mean slow at things, it HANGS numerous amount of times. If possible I can attach a video to it to make you understand if you all already don't know this. Please tell me I will do that too. 

If I pull, it hangs, and comes back after 10-20 secs, if I try to resolve conflict it does not allow me to do that unless hanging 2-3 times, even if I scroll down to the Stashes, it hangs, I just click on the Working copy in file status, it hangs, eventually everything I do in the source tree hangs. Do you have an fix for this or is it this way all through the way. 

The only reason I use source tree is because of the UI friendliness when it comes to viewing stashes, its easy to use it. But why do I have to pay such a high price of using that????

 

Do you have something here or Do I have to just stop using SourceTree and go to git bash. Perhaps the same thing is not there for Mac. Maybe you guys have invested more on MAc developers than Windows...!!!
fields.summary: How do you guys even let source tree for windows go to the users to be used?

 An item with the same key has already been added.

Thanks.

fields.description:
One day, one day, I'll try to do something with SourceTree and it will work.

And then I woke up.

And then one day I'll try to report a bug to Atlassian and I'll be able to.

And then I'll wake up again ...

fields.description:
We've tried using oauth and basic authentication and can't clone a repo. We've tried numerous methods found here and stackoverflow and can't find resolution. We've tried deleting the pw file in appdata,  clearing cache and using Google sign-in. Clone from Bitbucket into Sourcetree, and vice-versa. This is something we need solved asap as we have a couple more devs starting next week. 

 

This is our 4th developer in 3 weeks with no fix in place. They are using git/Bitbucket directly as a poor workaround.
fields.summary: Authentication issues in Sourcetree/Bitbucket

fields.description: Hello, the problem is in the client. When I launch the client, it shows me the number of commits. If I click the "Extract" button, it shows me a different number of commits. That is, the client gives me all commits from the server at the time the button is pressed. And if I click "Get", then I can not get all the changes from the server, which will lead to the fact that I am updating to the not current version and I do not understand it right away.
fields.summary: Sourcetree Extract bug
